title: Jeff Bezos might lose his spot as the world's richest person as Amazon shares tank. Here's how he makes and spends his billions.
text:
Jeff Bezos might lose his position as the wealthiest person alive after a disappointing earnings report sent both Amazon's share price and the CEO's net worth on a downward spiral on October 25.

The company's founder and CEO, Jeff Bezos was the first person in modern history to accumulate a fortune of over $100 billion — and he currently has a net worth of $110 billion, Bloomberg estimates.

He spends his fortune on real estate across the US, a $65 million Gulfstream Jet, and his space exploration company, Blue Origin.

Bezos is worth $111 billion, Bloomberg estimates.

Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories.

Jeff Bezos' position as the wealthiest person alive is under threat after a disappointing earnings report sent both Amazon's share price and the CEO's net worth on a downward spiral in after-hours trading on October 24.

Amazon shares fell 8.1% in after-hours trading, and Bezos' personal net worth fell $8.2 billion, according to Bloomberg estimates. Since most of Bezos' wealth is in the form of his ownership stake in Amazon, the company's success and his personal fortune are closely intertwined. He is still worth $111 billion.

Bezos' net worth also took a hit in July when he finalized his divorce from ex-wife MacKenzie Bezos, Business Insider previously reported. According to a statement from MacKenzie Bezos, Jeff Bezos retained 75% of the Amazon shares held by the couple, as well as their joint holdings in the Washington Post and space exploration venture Blue Origin after their split. Bezos' net worth fell $36 billion and MacKenzie became one of the richest women in the world, according to Bloomberg.

From real estate to space travel, here's how Bezos spends his money.
description: Jeff Bezos, founder and CEO of Amazon, is still the richest person alive. He's the first in modern history to accumulate a fortune over $100 billion.
